timeline.author: DaanHoogland

timeline.bodyText: @Spaceman1984 can you add tests for non zero values, and see if the expected results match? (for kbs, mbs, gbs)
timeline.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: @rhtyd these tests already exist in NumbersUtilTest.java
replies.author: Spaceman1984

timeline.bodyText: @Spaceman1984 can you add unit test for this method, giving some values such as zero and non-zero (to test KB, MB, GB, TB). Have you verified that all consumes would pass long to it and not Long which may potentially cause a NPE?
timeline.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText: I have added a check and a test for null which prevents an NPE.
replies.author: Spaceman1984

timeline.bodyText: @Spaceman1984 what's the default locale for CloudStack, is there a global setting or does it pick it up from OS?
timeline.author: rhtyd

replies.bodyText:
@rhtyd From Java Docs:
"The Java Virtual Machine sets the default locale during startup based on the host environment. It is used by many locale-sensitive methods if no locale is explicitly specified. It can be changed using the setDefault method."
replies.author: Spaceman1984

replies.bodyText: I think "C" is the default locale. maybe this or some other more worldly locale is a good idea?
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: @DaanHoogland I searched the code base, Cloudstack doesn't set a default locale, it will be picked up from the environment, which I believe is the correct behaviour.
replies.author: Spaceman1984
